div.head: For telling someone that by putting holding a finger to his forehead, you will prevent him from exiting a chamber
div.ab: XMake him put his arm around a bedpost or something similar, & with the same arm, let him hold a finger to his forehead.

div.head: XWager someone e that walking to a certain place and back, he cannot say boot without spurs four times in a row
div.ab: XIf he tries to say a it, but be sure that he speaks loudly, once he has been there & back, you will tell him that he has lost, because he needed to say boots four times without saying spurs, for that is your wager.

div.head: For making a candlestick hold to the wall without making a hole in it
div.ab: Make a servant hold it to the wall.

div.head: XHow not to break a glass with a log or a large stick
div.ab: XYou will cut from it a small piece as thick as a toothpick, & thus you will give to him from a log or a large stick that with which he will not be able to break the glass.

div.head: Writing cunningly
div.ab: Cut some long strips of fine parchment & mark them according to their order with A B C & c√¶tera, then sew them inside the hem of a shirt of rough cloth, like that of a messenger, who, if you want to take his shirt, will know nothing of it.
